lines.text: When you're born in the gutter you end up in the port.

[Following through with his suggestion that a solution might be found found in an analysis of Krank's "tears"]
Once upon a time there was an inventor so gifted that he could create life. A truly remarkable man.

[Sarcastically]
A fairy tale! Tears are welling in my eyes.

Since he had no wife or children he decided to create them in his laboratory. He started with wife and fas into the most beautiful princess in the world. Alas, a wicked genetic fairy cast a spell on the inventor so much so that the princess was only knee height or less. He then cloned six children in his own image, faithful, hardworking. They were so alike no one could tell them apart. But fate tricked him again, giving them all sleeping sickness. Craving someone to talk to he grew in a fish-tank a poor migraine-ridden brain. And then at last he created his masterpiece more intelligent then the most intelligent man on Earth.
But alas the inventor made a serious mistake. While his creation was intelligent he never ever had a dream. You can't image how his sadness made him quickly he grow old.

[Bismuth and the clones start rushes around for a dropper]
A dropper!
[Goes to Krank and gently uses it to get the tear]

[Disgusted]
The poor masterpiece became so crazed he believed a single tear drop could save him. And after many cruel deeds he died.

[shouting]
Never knowing what it was to dream!
Irvin, you know all about feelings. Won't you try to help me? Won't you explain why all those children only have nightmares?
Because you are their nightmare. You could persecute all the children in the world, but there's one thing you'll never have.
Because you believe you have one? You don't even have a body. The one who created us made us all monsters.
No Krank, you're wrong. You are the only monster here.

[Distressed]
Be Quiet! He is the only one responsible for that, I say I'm innocent. I'm innocent!

[Shuffles away and then turns back with regained composure]
In any case, I thank you for your help.

[after Krank's latest failiure]
Who stole the child's dreams? Krank, in his evil schemes. But the happy tale had a sting in it's tail. The genius has a fit of pique, hear the genius shriek, the 'genius' is up a creek.
Not as little as all that.
One sailor. Harpooned Whales. One night
always always the target I miss. One loses job.
What's it like to have a little brother?
Well, he can't complain he's got nobody to worry about him.

[Turns over]
Denree- little brother. Miette- little sister.
What about them? What do you know?
He takes them. The Devil takes them away. In his boat... he takes them to Hell.
he knows where. The map... the map of the minefield is tattooed on his body.
